title: Connection between SABIC chemical spill and odor complaints still unclear as DEC investigates
text:
By Michael Hallisey ,
1 hours ago DEC investigates release of 1,100 pounds of 2,6-Xylenol as residents report eye irritation, foul smells SABIC’s chemical spill raises concerns: no immediate threat, but public safety questions linger SELKIRK —It remains unclear whether there is a connection between the airborne odors residents have complained about since late November and the recently reported chemical spill at the SABIC plastic fabrication facility.
On Wednesday, Dec. 18, the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation (DEC) confirmed it is investigating reports of unpleasant odors near the SABIC facility following a chemical release earlier in the week. The investigation began after an inquiry by Spotlight News .
According to the DEC, the incident occurred at approximately 7 p.m. on Monday, Dec. 16, when a malfunction at the SABIC plant caused the accidental release of about 1,100 pounds of 2,6-Xylenol, a chemical compound commonly used in manufacturing. The liquid was contained within the facility’s secondary containment system, where it solidified. SABIC is currently collecting the solidified material for proper disposal.
Although local fire crews were not dispatched to the plastics plant during the spill, one unit in New Scotland did respond on Monday evening to a separate report of a noxious odor. A resident had complained of burning eyes. These incidents, along with the DEC’s subsequent report of the chemical release, appear to have been reported independently by residents.
The DEC stated that there is no immediate threat to public health or the environment. However, the agency is working with SABIC to determine the root cause of the malfunction and to implement corrective measures to prevent similar incidents in the future. The DEC is also monitoring compliance with environmental regulations.
“While there is no immediate threat to public health or the environment, DEC is working closely with SABIC to investigate the root cause of the malfunction, implement corrective actions to prevent future incidents, and ensure compliance with all environmental regulations. DEC will continue to monitor the situation and provide updates as necessary,” the department stated.
SABIC was contacted for comment but had not responded to email inquiries by Thursday afternoon.
On the night of the release, New Salem Fire Chief Steven Ayers said Albany County 911 received a call at 7:45 p.m. from a resident on Krumkill Road in the Town of New Scotland.
“The caller said that the air smelled like iodine and it was causing their eyes to burn,” Ayers said. “I could smell it by our firehouse on Route 85.”
The fire department checked the area and attempted to trace the source of the smell.
“We checked around the area all the way back [to Selkirk], but couldn’t find a source,” Ayers said. “We even called CSX to see what [trains] came through near that time, and there wasn’t any.”
Ayers said they could not confirm if the smell was coming from the SABIC plant but did notify county dispatchers, suggesting it might originate from that area.
Selkirk Fire Chief Tom Neri stated that his department did not receive any notification of the release nor calls from the public. He noted that the SABIC facility has its own fire brigade to handle on-site incidents and local fire departments are only involved if assistance is requested.
Albany County Sheriff Craig Apple said he was unaware of any notification regarding the release. Bethlehem Town Supervisor David VanLuven similarly reported no knowledge of a notification but acknowledged receiving complaints about a chemical smell in the air over the past two weeks.
Industry data sheets indicate that 2,6-Xylenol is toxic if swallowed or in contact with skin, causing burns and eye damage. It is a key monomer in the synthesis of polyphenylene ether (PPE), a high-performance thermoplastic known for its durability and heat resistance.
PPE is widely used in the production of automotive parts, electrical and electronic components, and industrial machinery.
Despite the DEC’s statement, residents in Bethlehem have been reporting odors since late November. Most complaints were shared on social media, while some were directed to local volunteer firehouses.
On Wednesday, Nov. 20, residents described a foul odor and speculated that it originated from SABIC’s facility in Selkirk. However, the Delmar and Selkirk firehouses reported no evidence of a chemical spill. The smell was later attributed to brush fires in Massachusetts.
The National Weather Service in Albany confirmed that a developing low-pressure system off the East Coast caused easterly winds to carry smoke into the Capital District that day. Winds were recorded at approximately 7 mph from the east and northeast.
Additionally, Chief Ayers noted a persistent mulch fire on New Scotland South Road, which has been burning for two weeks and required multiple fire department responses.
The DEC has yet to establish a connection between the recent spill and the odors reported since November. However, past incidents involving SABIC suggest the potential for broader impacts. In 2020, over 22,000 pounds of styrene vapor were released from an improperly stored railroad tanker at the facility. Then-DEC Commissioner Basil Seggos reported smelling the vapor from his New Scotland home before receiving official notice of the release. SABIC was later fined $322,000 for mishandling the tanker.
Residents are encouraged to report signs of contamination or chemical releases local 911 and to the NYS Spill Hotline at 1-800-457-7362.
John McIntyre contributed to this report.
The post Connection between SABIC chemical spill and odor complaints still unclear as DEC investigates first appeared on Spotlight News .

title: 以第15届全运会为新契机推动粤港澳大湾区竞技体育高质量发展|全运会_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
□张利超
　　第15届全国运动会（以下简称“十五运会”）将于2025年11月9日至21日在广东、香港、澳门三地举行，这是首次由粤港澳三地共同承办的全国综合性运动会，具有深远的意义。这一盛会不仅开启了区域间体育交流与协作的新篇章，同时也为推动粤港澳大湾区竞技体育高质量发展提供了重要契机。
　　加强湾区内部竞技体育资源整合
　　优化项目布局与资源配置。粤港澳大湾区内的各个城市在体育竞技领域展现出各自独特的专长与优势。例如，广州市在足球、篮球等团队运动及田径等基础项目上拥有强劲的实力；深圳市则在水上运动和马术等新兴领域迅速崛起；香港凭借其丰富的国际赛事经验和专业人才，在帆船帆板及马术比赛中占据重要地位；澳门则以其深厚的群众参与度，在武术和龙舟等传统文化体育活动中独树一帜。基于此，建议依据各城市的特色及其竞争优势，科学地规划和发展湾区内的体育竞赛项目，以避免重复建设和直接竞争，促进多样化发展。此外，还需突破地理界限，将三地之间的体育相关资源如财政支持、训练场地、设施配备以及人力资源等进行有效整合，构建资源共享且能优势互补的发展模式。比如可以创建一个涵盖整个大湾区范围的体育资源信息交换平台，定期更新并发布区域内各类体育资源的需求与供给状况，以此来推动资源的有效流动与合理配置。
　　强化人才交流与联合培养。在竞技体育领域，人才被视为发展的关键因素。粤港澳大湾区应当进一步增强区域内体育人才的互动及合作培养机制，通过构建一个稳定的人才交流平台，定期举办包括运动员、教练员、裁判员在内的各类专业人员交流活动，以此来增进三地之间专业知识和技术经验的共享。比如，可以组织面向整个湾区的体育人才研讨会，邀请来自三地的体育专家、学者以及教练们一同讨论最新的体育人才培养理论与实践方法；或者设立跨区域运动员训练营，让不同地方的运动员有机会联合训练和比赛，从而提升他们的竞赛水平。还应该鼓励三地的高等教育机构、体育学院以及科研单位之间建立更紧密的合作关系，比如共同开设教育项目或开展体育科研工作，携手培育出更多高水平的体育专业人才。为此，建议创建一个专门服务大湾区体育人才发展的联盟组织，负责协调利用三方教育资源，推出一系列联合教学课程，使学生们能够在不同的高校间实现学分互认，并通过参与多样化的学术交流活动来丰富个人经验，提高综合能力。
　　共建共享训练基地与设施。体育训练场所和相关基础设施对于竞技体育的进步起着至关重要的作用。粤港澳大湾区应当强化区域内训练资源的合作共建，以此来防止不必要的重复投资及资源浪费。各城市可根据自身条件和发展优势，建设特色鲜明的专业训练中心，并对外开放给其他地区使用。比如，广州市可以凭借丰富的体育场馆资源，打造一个集多种功能于一体的综合型训练基地，为整个湾区内的运动员们提供优质的训练场地；深圳市则可以在大鹏半岛等地段开发专门针对水上运动项目的训练基地，满足如帆船、赛艇等水体项目的专业训练需求；香港与澳门也可以利用高度国际化且设施先进的体育环境，为湾区内顶尖选手创造更高水平的训练及竞赛平台。此外，还需加强训练基地及其配套设施的管理力度，通过建立预约机制等方式提高资源利用率，确保这些宝贵的训练资源能够得到最优化的使用，从而为推动粤港澳大湾区竞技体育事业的发展作出积极贡献。
　　借助全运会提升湾区竞技体育水平
　　借鉴先进训练理念与方法。全运会作为国内最高级别的综合性体育赛事，聚集了来自全国各地的顶尖运动员及先进的训练理念和技术。粤港澳大湾区内的教练员和运动员应当充分利用这一平台，积极吸收其他省份的成功经验，不断革新自身的训练思维、优化训练手段。例如，可以邀请国内著名教练到大湾区开展专题讲座或培训课程，分享其宝贵的训练经验和成果；安排教练员与运动员前往其他省份的训练中心参观学习，亲身体验高水平的训练设施与模式。通过多种方式的学习与借鉴，并结合大湾区的具体情况，开发出一套适合本地运动员发展的训练体系与方法，从而提升训练的质量与效率，增强粤港澳大湾区在竞技体育领域的整体竞争力。
　　加强与国际高水平运动队的交流与合作。粤港澳大湾区位于中国改革开放的最前沿，拥有无与伦比的国际化背景。应当充分利用这一独特条件，深化同世界各地高水平体育团队的合作关系，借鉴国外先进的训练方法、技术手段以及管理策略。比如，可以邀请世界著名的运动队伍到粤港澳大湾区参与友谊赛、交流训练等活动，使得本地运动员能够直接面对国际顶尖选手，在实际对抗中学习和成长；派遣杰出的运动员和教练前往海外优秀团队进修或培训，以此扩大他们的国际视野，增强其在全球舞台上的竞争力。另外，积极争取举办各类重要国际赛事的机会，例如奥运会资格赛、世界杯预选赛等，为湾区内运动员提供更多参与国际竞赛的平台，积累宝贵的实战经验，从而有效提升他们参加国际比赛时的表现水平。
　　鼓励湾区运动员参与国际竞争。粤港澳大湾区应积极促进并支持运动员参加各类国际竞赛，为运动员提供更多参赛机会与有利条件。政府及相关机构需增加对运动员参赛的资金援助力度，改善其待遇和保障措施，消除他们的顾虑；同时，还应当强化对运动员参与国际赛事的指导与服务，提供专业化的翻译、医疗及后勤支持，以确保运动员能够全身心投入比赛。除此之外，还需构建一套激励体系，对在国际赛事中取得优异成绩的运动员及其教练给予丰厚奖励，以此激发他们的积极性与主动性，从而吸引更多运动员投身于国际赛场，为国家赢得荣誉的同时也为大湾区增添光彩。
　　借助全运会提升湾区竞技体育知名度
　　加大宣传力度，提高湾区竞技体育知名度。全运会作为国内最具影响力的体育赛事，具有强大的品牌效应和社会关注度。粤港澳大湾区应充分利用全运会契机，加大宣传力度，提高大湾区竞技体育的知名度和影响力。十五运会期间，通过电视、报纸及互联网等多种媒介平台，从多维度对湾区内竞技体育的发展现状进行报道，展现运动员们的卓越表现以及该地区体育事业所取得的成绩；同时，在比赛场地内外布置关于湾区竞技体育成就的信息展示板和海报等材料，营造积极正面的形象氛围，吸引更多人关注湾区体育发展；此外，还应加强与国内外新闻机构的对接，通过生动鲜活的报道，将粤港澳大湾区竞技体育的故事传递给全球观众，以此提高国际声誉。
　　扩大商业赞助及合作伙伴网络。商业资助对于竞技体育的成长至关重要。粤港澳大湾区应充分利用全运会的品牌效应，积极开拓商业赞助途径，吸引更多企业和社会资本参与大湾区竞技体育事业。政府及相关机构应当制定激励措施，如税收减免、广告推广等优惠政策，以促进企业赞助的积极性；同时，还须强化对商业赞助活动的监管机制，确保资金使用的透明度与效率；此外，加强与国际体育组织和知名品牌的合作，也是必不可少的一环，通过引入海外先进的体育产业管理模式和经验，可以进一步提升大湾区在竞技体育领域的国际化程度。通过增强商业赞助及合作，能够为大湾区竞技体育的发展提供坚实的财力支持。
　　打造具有湾区特色的竞技体育品牌活动。品牌活动是提升竞技体育影响力和吸引力的重要载体。粤港澳大湾区应结合自身地域文化特色和体育资源优势，打造一批具有国际影响力和市场竞争力的竞技体育品牌活动。例如，举办大湾区帆船赛、龙舟赛、马拉松赛等具有地方特色的体育赛事，将体育赛事与大湾区的自然风光、人文景观、历史文化等相结合，打造具有独特魅力的体育旅游产品。同时，应当重视对这些品牌活动的长期培育与发展，通过连续多年的专业策划与实施，逐渐提高它们的社会认知度与影响力，使之成为展示大湾区体育风采的重要窗口。此外，还应促进这类活动向更加商业化方向转型，邀请经验丰富的赛事管理团队参与其中，以提升比赛的整体质量和经济效益，确保这些品牌赛事能够持续健康发展。
　　十五运会为粤港澳大湾区竞技体育发展提供了难得的历史机遇，同时也提出了更高层次的要求。面对这一机遇与挑战并存的局面，粤港澳三地需要加强合作与交流，共同进步，充分利用各自的优势资源，促进区域内竞技体育的高质量发展。通过借助全运会这一平台提高湾区运动员的整体实力、提升湾区竞技体育知名度，打造具有国际竞争力的粤港澳大湾区竞技体育体系，为助力我国加快体育强国建设贡献力量。
　　作者简介：张利超，广州航海学院体育学院院长、教授
　　基金项目：2023年国家社科基金一般项目“我国群众体育、竞技体育、学校体育协同发展研究”（编号：23BTY002），广东省体育局2024-2025年体育文化发展科研项目（编号：GDSS2024N041）

author: 김서정 기자
title: Northern Gyeonggi Freezes as Temperatures Plunge to -10°C Amid Intense Cold Wave
text:
Extreme Cold at -10°C, with Winds
Lower Feels-Like Temperature, Stay Healthy
Cold Wave Continues in Northern Gyeonggi
[Cheonji Ilbo Gyeonggi=Kim Seojung] A cold wave warning has been issued for Yeoncheon, Pocheon, Gapyeong, and Paju in Gyeonggi Province, as extremely cold weather is expected to continue in northern Gyeonggi tomorrow (4th). The morning low temperatures in inland areas of northern Gyeonggi are forecasted to drop below -10°C, with strong winds further lowering the perceived temperatures.
The morning low temperatures in northern Gyeonggi are expected to range between -10°C and -5°C, while the daytime highs are forecasted to be between 3°C and 5°C. The skies will generally remain clear, although some clouds are expected to increase in the afternoon. The weather in the West Sea’s Five Islands (Seohae 5-do) will also remain partly cloudy.
Starting early morning on the 5th, rain or snow is likely to fall in northern Gyeonggi. Significant snowfall of up to 3–8 cm is anticipated in the northwest and eastern regions of Gyeonggi, with some areas experiencing heavy, wet snow falling at a rate of 1–2 cm per hour. This will likely lead to icy roads, especially on bridges, elevated roads, and at tunnel entrances and exits, increasing the risk of accidents.
To ensure safety, residents are advised to prepare winter equipment for vehicles, check road conditions in advance, and use public transportation whenever possible.
According to the Korea Meteorological Administration, northern Gyeonggi is expected to experience rain or snow due to an approaching trough of low pressure on the 5th. Subsequently, a cold continental high-pressure system is expected to expand, causing temperatures to plummet again significantly.
Residents in northern Gyeonggi are strongly advised to stay informed about the latest weather updates, prepare for sudden temperature changes, and take precautions to ensure their health and safety.

author: Catholic News Agency
title: Australian bishop Christopher Saunders arrested, charged with rape
text: Rome Newsroom, Feb 22, 2024 / 16:10 pm (CNA). Christopher Saunders, the bishop emeritus of Broome, Australia, has been arrested and charged with rape and other charges based at least in part on the findings of a Vatican investigation into allegations he abused vulnerable young men. Authorities announced Thursday that they were charging the 74-year-old prelate with two counts of rape, 14 counts of unlawful and indecent assault, and three counts of indecently dealing with a child as a person in authority, which reportedly occurred in the towns of Broome, Kununurra, and the Aboriginal community of Kalumburu between 2008 and 2014. The Australian Broadcasting Corporation [reported](https://www.abc.net.au/news/2024-02-22/former-broome-bishop-saunders-to-deny-19-criminal-charges/103496282) that Saunders will plead not guilty to the charges brought against him. Saunders was released on bail on a AU$10,000 ($6,500) bond on Thursday and has been ordered by the Broome Magistrates Court to reside at this home until the initial hearing in June. In a [press release](https://www.catholic.au/s/article/Matter-regarding-Bishop-Christopher-Saunders) published on Thursday, Archbishop Timothy Costelloe, president of the Australian Catholic Bishops’ Conference, said the allegations made against Saunders “are very serious and deeply distressing, especially for those making those allegations.” Noting that it is “right and proper, and indeed necessary, that all such allegations be thoroughly investigated,” Costelloe expressed that the Church “will continue to cooperate fully with the police and take every necessary step to avoid any actions which may compromise the integrity and autonomy of the police investigation.” Saunders was ordained to the priesthood in 1976. Before he was appointed the bishop of Broome in 1996, he had several assignments with aboriginal parishes. The Diocese of Broome, a suffragan diocese of the Archdiocese of Perth, is located in the remote northwestern region of Kimberley in the state of Western Australia and covers an area of approximately 297,000 square miles. Allegations were first made in 2020 against Saunders, who took a step back from the active governance of the diocese later that year. He formally resigned in 2021, citing “ill health.” After an initial police investigation did not result in any charges against Saunders, Pope Francis ordered a canonical investigation — the first of its kind in Australia — following his 2019 motu proprio [Vos Estis Lux Mundi](https://www.vatican.va/content/francesco/en/motu_proprio/documents/20230325-motu-proprio-vos-estis-lux-mundi-aggiornato.html), which established a new set of norms for the universal Church concerning the procedural handling of sexual abuse cases. The investigation was overseen by Archbishop Mark Coleridge of the Archdiocese of Brisbane but carried out by private investigators, culminating in a 200-page report. A new investigation was opened on the allegations brought against Saunders after the report was handed over to Australian police. In January, detectives from the Child Abuse Squad raided Saunders’ former home as part of “an ongoing investigation into historic child sex offenses.” Australian news outlet [7NEWS](https://7news.com.au/news/wa/wa-police-call-for-church-authorities-to-hand-over-vatican-report-into-bishop-of-broome-sex-scandal-c-11958237) in September 2023 obtained the investigative report, which detailed a pattern of grooming young men and occasions of coercing young men to undress and perform sexual acts. The report also noted that Saunders held “bunga-bunga” parties, which were attended only by young men. The bombshell report stated that Saunders “spent hundreds of thousands of dollars grooming vulnerable young Aboriginal males by supplying them with gifts of alcohol, telephones, cash, and travel.” “The bishop has been variously described by witnesses as … a sexual predator that seeks to prey upon vulnerable Aboriginal men and boys,” the investigative report said.
